abstracts.cdata!:
The Capacity Building Project for
            Economic Management is designed to address basic weaknesses
            in the Chadian public administration. It will reinforce
            progress made under the First Economic and Financial
            Management Project (GEF) and will help to: 1) rebuild the
            administration around a civil service of modest size with a
            clear focus on core public sector functions and in which
            transparent and criteria-based recruitment, career planning,
            training and career management will be targeted; 2) restore
            the government's capacity to provide essential public
            goods and services, improve its public finance management;
            3) improve the quality and efficiency of public
            expenditures; and 4) implement the government's
            divestiture program. The components of the project are the
            following: 1) consultancy services; 2) studies; 3) technical
            assistance (including local expertise); 4) equipment,
            vehicles, and supplies; 5) training; and 6) office rehabilitation.
